statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Drew Neitzel, Maurice Joseph and Marquise Gray each scored 13 points to pace a balanced attack in Michigan State's win over Indiana-Purdue-Fort Wayne on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Michigan State crushes IPFW with tight defense
article.linkText: Michigan State's tight defense crushes IPFW
article.story: EAST LANSING, Mich. (AP) -- Drew Neitzel, Maurice Joseph and Marquise Gray each scored 13 points to pace a balanced attack in Michigan State's 80-43 win over Indiana-Purdue-Fort Wayne on Wednesday night. Neitzel and Joseph each had four 3-point baskets for the Spartans (8-2). Gray was 6-for-9 from the field and had eight rebounds off the bench. Goran Suton had 10 points and nine rebounds for Michigan State (No. 25 ESPN/USA Today). Travis Walton added nine points and seven assists. Tyler Best scored 12 points and Jaraun Burrows 10 for the Mastodons (3-6), who shot just 14.3 percent from the field in the second half and 26.5 percent for the game. Michigan State shot 55.6 percent in a 39-24 first half. The Spartans tightened up their defense after the break and pulled away with 41-19 dominance in the last 20 minutes. Michigan State had edges of 45-25 in rebounds and 22-11 in assists to improve to 7-0 at home this year.
